item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, August 27, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Sainsbury Wing contractors find 1990 letter from donor (152 points | 29 comments)
2. The historical distinction between coder and programmer (31 points | 39 comments)
3. Launch HN: Bucket Robotics (YC S24) – Defect detection for molded and cast parts (47 points | 9 comments)
4. Is 'No tax on tips' a distraction from the fight to end sub-minimum wages? (53 points | 47 comments)
5. Box64 and RISC-V in 2024: What It Takes to Run the Witcher 3 on RISC-V (314 points | 118 comments)
6. New 0-Day Attacks Linked to China's 'Volt Typhoon' (143 points | 28 comments)
7. Splatt3R: Zero-Shot Gaussian Splatting from Uncalibrated Image Pairs (77 points | 14 comments)
8. Anthropic publishes the 'system prompts' that make Claude tick (214 points | 138 comments)
9. Great Question (YC W21) Is Hiring Customer Support Lead ( | hide)
10. Ruby in Jupyter Notebook (139 points | 46 comments)
11. Zuckerberg claims regret on caving to White House pressure on content (248 points | 494 comments)
12. To kill mammoths in the Ice Age, people used planted pikes, not throwing spears (44 points | 29 comments)
13. MiniJinja: Learnings from Building a Template Engine in Rust (73 points | 23 comments)
14. Cerebras launches inference for Llama 3.1; benchmarked at 1846 tokens/s on 8B (27 points | 5 comments)
15. Cerebras Inference: AI at Instant Speed (68 points | 39 comments)
16. Clay (short for C Layout) is a high performance 2D UI layout library (155 points | 51 comments)
17. The Triple Failure of 2U, EdX, and Axim (215 points | 149 comments)
18. Show HN: High school robotics code/CAD/design binder release (62 points | 16 comments)
19. Clojure Desktop UI Framework (247 points | 99 comments)
20. Show HN: Outperforming VByte for Large Integers Using Phi-Encoding (11 points | 4 comments)
21. Bootstrappable Builds (35 points | 7 comments)
22. Erasure Coding for Distributed Systems (265 points | 50 comments)
23. Eazel, ex-Apple led Linux startup (113 points | 52 comments)
24. Nuclear reactors a mile underground promise safe, cheap power (112 points | 230 comments)
25. Why has Japan been hit with rice shortages despite normal crops? (113 points | 142 comments)
26. A New Wave of Underwater Comms Is Coming (3 points | discuss)
27. A somewhat faster, more lightweight, ripgrep-inspired alternative (3 points | discuss)
28. Malware infiltrates Pidgin messenger's official plugin repository (3 points | discuss)
29. We built an open-source UIPath alternative that solves problem in all RPA (3 points | 1 comment)
30. The End of Finale (117 points | 104 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, August 27, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
